annonsrubrik: Quality Inspector Installation Work for ENERCON
annonstext:
Do you have experience in quality inspection of installation works and wants to help create a better and sustainable future? Come join ENERCON in Sweden and the Nordic region!

ENERCON is one of the leading wind power companies in the world and we are proud of our business contributing to a better world! We offer you the possibility to take on an exciting role with the opportunity to contribute and develop your own skills!

Your new job

We’re looking for a Quality Inspector who wants to take on the responsibility of quality control of installation works in projects on our windfarm construction sites throughout the Nordics.

The Quality Inspector Installation Works is responsible for checking the work of the installation teams, from goods receiving of the individual WEC-components on the construction site up to the finalization of installation works and handover of the WEC to ENERCON Service Centre. Such quality control is done according to the general ITP for installation works (IW) and ends with the coordination of takeover of the IW from the installation team.

The Quality Inspector is the “eye” on the construction site to be a valuable partner for the Supervisor Installation Works and Construction Manager pointing out unusual proceedings which might lead to delays, quality or safety issues.

The role requires a very organized and proactive approach, combined with a strong attention to detail, high level of initiative, and ability to multi-task.

Short overview of the tasks:

	Ensuring compliance with the specifications from the current assembly instructions at installation team level
	Identification of installation quality deficiencies and proactive support to the corrective measures
	Monitoring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations
	Recording and processing non-conformities and monitoring their completion on site
	Complete quality control documentation
	Checking and filling construction journals, assembly and repair reports  
	Complete handover procedure to local service departments

This is a permanent role, based in Sweden but will include travels to different construction sites in Sweden but also sites throughout the Nordic region and Germany. Travels are necessary and you need to be flexible regarding working hours and travelling times. You will report to Installations Team Leader.

The employment usually starts with a solid training period, typically held in Germany. 

Requirements for position

	Completed vocational training in a technical field
	2-3 years of technical work experience
	First experience in Construction Sites or Wind Industry
	Good technical understanding
	Ability to work at heights
	Flexible regarding working hours and travelling times
	Proficient with all MS Office applications and good FIRSTNAME LASTNAME and SAP user skills
	Good command of English in speech and writing and preferably knowledge of Swedish
	EU Class B driving license
	Travel readiness (international)

To be successful in this role we believe that you have a good understanding of installation works and experience of a variety of stakeholders. You have a well-structured, diplomatic and proactive approach, an independent work style and good organizational skills. In addition, you are determined, quality-conscious and able to make decisions. Furthermore, you have a flexibility in regards to traveling and working hours and are able to work at heights.

Application

You apply with your CV and cover letter by sending them to  EMAIL . Mark the application with “QI IW Nordics”. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, however no later than April 1st. All enquiries are treated confidentially.

 

About us

One of the most responsible tasks of our time is to utilize the resources in the form of earth, wind and water that exist on earth to create sustainable energy from them. Through its wind power technology, ENERCON has accepted the challenge of contributing to a better future. Innovation, quality and safety have greatly contributed to our successes and we are today one of the leading wind power companies in the world.

Motivated staff and customers have contributed to ENERCON's global success with production facilities on three continents and market representation in 46 countries. ENERCON is a family business that is now owned by a foundation. The head office is located in Aurich in northwestern Germany, the city where inventor Alois Wobben founded the company in 1984. Our Nordic head office is located in Malmö.

More information about the Group can be found at: http://www.enercon.de/en/home/
